intro: Ardisia villosa var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of India and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its berries are typically red or black when mature and are an important food source for various wildlife. The smooth ardisia is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and seasonal flowering.
